public IntBuffer getIntBuffer()

start

public void start()
Description copied from class: GeomData
resets the buffer to zero and prepares to receive data from the various set() calls. In some implementations this will destroy data.

getIntData

public int[] getIntData()
Returns an array with all the floats assigned in the last draw cycle. In some implementations this might return a copy, so only use if you have to. The data should not be changed once it is retrieved and should be considered read only.

Returns:
An array of floats

getByteData

public byte[] getByteData()
Returns an array with all the bytes assigned in the last draw cycle. In some implementations this might return a copy, so only use if you have to. The data should not be changed once it is retrieved and should be considered read only.

Returns:
An array of byte
